comments.author: honzab.moz@firemni.cz
comments.text:
As seen from the graph at [1] we have thousands of 0ms and >10s buckets that make hard to look at the reasonable data of the graph for this probe (hard to see the slopes).

As this is one of the most important probes we have, we may want to think about this one particular a bit more, e.g. if should also collect a subset of probes for some scenarios (number of sub-resources, network type if known, etc).

I'll check why we get so many 0ms times, seems to me as a bug or a feature we don't want (just ignore 0ms time, I suspect background loads do this).

I'll add a new probe that will collect the number of pages that were loaded before or after a time of 10s and make the current one ignore measures with time >=10s.

I also think, to get rid of the current not well collected data, we should either:
- allow graphs be filtered by time> or build-id> (to use data after the fix)
- rename the current probe
- add a new probe that is fixed from this issue

I also lack a statistical analyzes on the server giving results like "50% of all pages load between 300ms and 1800ms" or "90% of all pages load between 900ms and 1100ms" (probably a different bug, though).


[1] https://metrics.mozilla.com/pentaho/content/pentaho-cdf-dd/Render?solution=metrics&path=telemetry/&file=TelemetryHistogram.wcdf
comments.creator: honzab.moz@firemni.cz
comments.raw_text:
As seen from the graph at [1] we have thousands of 0ms and >10s buckets that make hard to look at the reasonable data of the graph for this probe (hard to see the slopes).

As this is one of the most important probes we have, we may want to think about this one particular a bit more, e.g. if should also collect a subset of probes for some scenarios (number of sub-resources, network type if known, etc).

I'll check why we get so many 0ms times, seems to me as a bug or a feature we don't want (just ignore 0ms time, I suspect background loads do this).

I'll add a new probe that will collect the number of pages that were loaded before or after a time of 10s and make the current one ignore measures with time >=10s.

I also think, to get rid of the current not well collected data, we should either:
- allow graphs be filtered by time> or build-id> (to use data after the fix)
- rename the current probe
- add a new probe that is fixed from this issue

I also lack a statistical analyzes on the server giving results like "50% of all pages load between 300ms and 1800ms" or "90% of all pages load between 900ms and 1100ms" (probably a different bug, though).


[1] https://metrics.mozilla.com/pentaho/content/pentaho-cdf-dd/Render?solution=metrics&path=telemetry/&file=TelemetryHistogram.wcdf
